website_summaries.verdict: A water-resistant compression bag that gives you quick access to your belongings, but be careful not to overfill it.
pros: Quick-release buckles give you easy access to your items
Fits into its own storage pocket when not in use
cons: A few users have complained of seams splitting when the bag is too full

customer_reviews.title: Crappy construction
customer_reviews.text: Crappy product, very shoddy construction. This was suggested to be the compression sack for the Kelty cosmic 20 down sleeping bag. As you can see from the picture it cant handle being used... I will update once the manufacturer responds. I've had this a whole day and it didn't make it through its intended use.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Moon

customer_reviews.title: Sizes
customer_reviews.text: Just wanted to leave a note on the dimensions of the bags. Small = 6" x 12" Medium = 8" x 15" large = 10" x 18" X-large = 11" x 22"
customer_reviews.author: Stimpy

customer_reviews.title: This product failed my expectation. upon first use, ...
customer_reviews.text: This product failed my expectation. upon first use, when i tried to compress the bag the stitching started to give away. was not impressed at all. go get the ALPS compression bag. its much more sturdier..
customer_reviews.author: higuy

customer_reviews.title: Rhubarb - Compatible Kelty Cosmic 20 Sleeping Bag
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the womens Kelty Cosmic 20 Sleeping Bag and realized I did not have a compression stuff sack included. I was shocked because of how much it cost but it is what it is. I purchased the medium size which is the color Rhubarb. The sizes are color coordinated hopefully this helps you if you get confused which one to buy. It fit nicely and I did not have any issues with it. Over all I am happy with. Going on my first backpacking trip with this sack and hoping it will last through. I noticed people wrote bad reviews of it ripping but I think they most likely bought the wrong size and over stuffed it. Thanks Kelty!
customer_reviews.author: April W.

customer_reviews.title: Nice Stuff Sack
customer_reviews.text: The color is a little darker in real life but I appreciate that. It would have been nice if they went the extra mile and treated it with silicone and added some sideways compression straps but I can do that myself. The red is dark enough that it doesn't stand out too bad in the woods but the orange one is just garish and I would never strap it to the bottom of my pack. One of these days Kelty, REI and the like will remember that some of us like their outdoor gear to actually match the outdoors.
customer_reviews.author: John Smith

customer_reviews.title: Broken clasp but Still a great product
customer_reviews.text: The bag is a great size, I was able to compress a pair of pants, three shirts, three pairs of socks, and three pair of underwear. A downfall is that The spring did not work in the plastic clasp so I had to tie the string. It was a last minute order so I just accepted the fact it didn’t work. I have other Kelty products that work great so this was a minor disappointment, I recommend this product since I believe the broken clasp is an issolated issue.
customer_reviews.author: MandyK

customer_reviews.title: Ripped first time using it.
customer_reviews.text: First time using this the seam ripped open before I even used the compression straps. Now I didn't go stuffing it so much that it should rip open. I don't know if I got a bad one but unfortunately it's useless now as it just keeps ripping bigger and bigger if I try to use it. And now it's too late to return it. My advise would be use it as soon as you gett it to make sure it holds up, so if it doesn't you can return it. Kelty has awesome products, not sure what happened with this one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for compressing clothes or sleep system.
customer_reviews.text: Works great. I put my sleeping bag, hammock, inflatable pillow and insect net in this sack and I can compress it all down to the size of about two 2-liter bottles. I wish the buckles were a little further apart so I could cinch down a little tighter. Strong material and water resistant.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: It is definitely a small bag!
customer_reviews.text: It was not until after I ordered it that I found a list of the sizes (which are based on color). This bag appears to be well made but it is quite small. I want to stuff a small child's mummy bag in and it is a VERY tight fit. Not much happening in the way of additional compression. We have yet to use it out hiking so I can't attest to how it will hold up after continued use. Hopefully it will live up to what I am accustomed to with the Kelty brand.
customer_reviews.author: MTenneZ

customer_reviews.title: For the price, This is a super awesome stuff sack and great value
customer_reviews.text: Good stuff Sack. This one is large enough for the cheaper larger polyfill bags. The material is rugged and strong. The clips look like they will hold up. This is not as nice in terms of long trail adventures in regards to weight or function as some higher end ultralight bags. The top flap, is a little small in my opinion. It ends up mashing down the end of the sack with a Sleeping bag in it, rather than containing the entire diameter of the full sack. For the price, it's a super awesome bag and value
customer_reviews.author: Candy Lover

customer_reviews.title: Great to have during camp
customer_reviews.text: These work great!! My son who is a boy scout has used these for the last three summer camps and they work great. He uses them for his dirty clothes and he can make the bags very compact so they don't take too much space in his backpack and it isolates the dirty clothes from the rest of the stuff inside the backpack. Definitely worth buying.
customer_reviews.author: Lucylu

customer_reviews.title: Very lightweight
customer_reviews.text: I like Kelty products in general because they are typically quite durable. This compression sack is no exception. It is very lightweight, yet very strong. I've stuffed it almost to the max with a down sleeping bag liner over time and the seams still seem to be holding up. Disclaimer: I haven't used this bag on a trek, so I don't know how it holds up in extreme conditions. But this is definitely NOT a waterproof bag.
customer_reviews.author: Sherry Berhow

customer_reviews.title: Kelly has a good reputation, having been in the outdoor game for ...
customer_reviews.text: Kelly has a good reputation, having been in the outdoor game for so long. I kept that in mind when picking this stuff sack. And sure enough, Kelly pulled through. I've had two cooler weather sleeping bags in these - at separate times, of course - one larger, the other slightly smaller. The bag has compressed both bags exceptionally well on numerous occasions now. This worked especially well when I bought a smaller weekend pack (40L). I'd recommend trying it out, or go with an REI stuff sack. That was my alternative if this didn't work out.
customer_reviews.author: Alec Olson

customer_reviews.title: Great at compression pretty heavy though.
customer_reviews.text: My stuff sack got destroyed by rolling off a cliff into some trees (cough....f***ing Brian!). Got this as a replacement, works well, but is much heavier than the original stuff sack so its not great for backpacking. I do like that it compresses it way down to save space though.
customer_reviews.author: Travis Thran

customer_reviews.title: Holds a child's sleeping bag
customer_reviews.text: I have many Kelty products and have enjoyed them all. When my son lost his sleep bag stuff sack at Cub Scout camp I went on the hunt to find a compression sack that would hold a child sized Kelty sleeping bag but would have straps so that I could hook onto his backpack. This product does both and I look forward to using it at spring camp.
customer_reviews.author: ucbear9600

customer_reviews.title: I like this sack
customer_reviews.text: I like this sack, and Kelty has a good name for itself, so, I bought it knowing I might encounter danger at the seams. It turns out it served well under use, but I don't know if those seams will hold under long term use. I would rather have continuous straps than have sewn-in ones. So while I like this, I have doubts that it will withstand against rugged compression. Then again, I can't say for sure that it won't survive it, either.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Solid Compression Sack
customer_reviews.text: Solid compression sack, used it for clothing for a three week backcountry trek in Iceland here's what fit: lightweight down jacket, rain jacket, rain pants, 4 pairs of underwear, 4 pairs of wool socks, 2 tshirts, one merino wool baselayer, one spandex baselayer (torso), one spandex baselayer (legs), a hat and gloves. Just press it all in and cinch it up and it'll all pack down to a nice little pack.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin Block

customer_reviews.title: This thing is cool!
customer_reviews.text: My first Kelty purchase! It's pretty cool, stores away inside itself, fits two of my sleeping system bags, doubles as a laundry bag when i'm at sunmer camp.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Bottomless pit
customer_reviews.text: This is what you might expect from a compression sack. It works. Fits a whole sleeping bag. Compared to other bags, this one worked, while the other didnt fit.
customer_reviews.author: [name not found]

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy - cheap materials and poor craftsmanship
customer_reviews.text: I cannot recommend this product. The bag was shipped to me (not in original packaging) with a large hole in the side of it rendering it completely useless. That aside, that material is very fragile and frays easily. This is not a rugged item nor is it anywhere near what I expect from a Kelty product. I bought this bag for an upcoming trip, unfortunately I now have to return it and won't have the extra compression sack I was counting on. I was 100% dissatisfied with this purchase and this may dissuade me from purchasing Kelty products in the future.
customer_reviews.author: A Train

customer_reviews.title: Creates so much more room in my pack!
customer_reviews.text: Love it. The compression sacks allow me to pack all my back packing gear with greater ease and it creates a lot more space in my back pack. These sacks are east to use and compress things I didn't even think could! It makes my sleeping bag about 2/3 the size it would be in the sack it came in. Which is a lot of saved space!
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Stuff it.
customer_reviews.text: Very nice compression bag. KELTY is a big name in outdoor/backpacking gear. Great quality. I got the "Deep Blue" (largest one) for storing a soft car cover, and it's the perfect size. Imagine it would also be great for hiking with a medium-weight sleeping bag.... or a whole lot of marshmallows... (you decide).
customer_reviews.author: Tagleford Finnicks VonKrapenstein

customer_reviews.title: Draw string retainer will not hold
customer_reviews.text: I have several Kelty items and have always been impressed. I recently purchased three new compression sacks for a backpacking trip. The green and rhubarb sack both had string retaining tabs that did not work at all. I had to continuously tie a knot in the string in order to use the sack and then mess with undoing the knot each time I needed in. I could not find a section for contacting the seller to resolve the issue so I can only give it a three. Still compresses but a pain to deal with.
customer_reviews.author: booksforarneson

customer_reviews.title: thinking that would be fine based on some of the other reviews and size ...
customer_reviews.text: Probably should have gone with an extra-large. Bought the large for my very average sized sleeping bag, thinking that would be fine based on some of the other reviews and size charts, but it was really too tight of a fit.
customer_reviews.author: mixedblood74

customer_reviews.title: Great service from amazon and kelty but the compression sack ...
customer_reviews.text: Great service from amazon and kelty but the compression sack is just not meant to be used for compressing anything. I got the deep blue which is the extra large and the same size as my 50L pack and when I put my -29 degree kelty in the compression sack the seam tore.
customer_reviews.author: Cassie

customer_reviews.title: Great for Many Uses
customer_reviews.text: Compression sacks are greatest thing since sliced bread. I use them mostly for traveling, usually either as a way to store all of my cold weather gear in one place or as a laundry bag. I bought this one to store a bulky old sleeping bag in, and it fits perfectly. I love that it has a handle on one end!
customer_reviews.author: ND nice

customer_reviews.title: A good sack...
customer_reviews.text: At 3.7 ounces this compression sack works great for sleeping bags or clothing. Stuffed a Kelty Cosmic 20 in here with a coolmax liner and still had room. Compression feels good... no seam or strap popping. Stays compressed in a moving backpack quite well. Does not create oval shaped holes in the seams when under heavy compression. Waterproof trash compacter bag inside or outside makes a nice waterproof(Dry-Sakish) sack.
customer_reviews.author: NLJ

customer_reviews.title: Not useful for a Kelty Tuck 22 Long
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a Large for my Kelty Tuck 22 Long sleeping bag. One side has the straps on a 6" x 6" patch so when trying to compress the sleeping bag it puffs out negativing the compression.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Baranski

customer_reviews.title: Sleeping bag compressor
customer_reviews.text: Less expensive than other bags, but not the cheapest either. (China mart compression sacks are not worth the bother) I will not be overly aggressive while compressing - evenly pulling straps will help with the stress (I worry about sewn seam integrity), but it does reduce mass by almost half on my Big Agnes Encampment bag. Bought another Large for spouse's bag and an extra large for our tent. We MC camp and needed to reduce these items in size. We then put them in a roll top dry bag and tie down on one of the bikes.
customer_reviews.author: KWilder

customer_reviews.title: They work great for travel
customer_reviews.text: I have 4 of these in different sizes. They work great for travel. I use them instead of the zip lock vacuum bags and instead of packing cubes. They are by far one of my favorite and most used travel accessories
customer_reviews.author: bw

customer_reviews.title: Great budget alternative.
customer_reviews.text: These compression sacks are not as lightweight as the sea to summits, but for the price these do just as well. We could get my whole sleeping bag, liner, hammock, and bug net into this guy and compress it decently small. These also do well for more than camping, but that is our main use for it is traveling and camping. they are still light weight and do amazingly well.
customer_reviews.author: KrysTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff sack
customer_reviews.text: Works for stuff sack for my sierra designs 12 degree dri down bag long. Happy this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: RJM

customer_reviews.title: Order right size
customer_reviews.text: I really liked the structure of the product and the fact that the flap at top was connected on one side. Seemed like better option than other similar priced items. However make sure you order right size as it is based on which color you order. I wanted extra large and ended up with medium and realized too late.
customer_reviews.author: Montana Angela

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product.
customer_reviews.text: Love this stuff sack. Lightweight and compressed my 20 degreee mummy bag to about half its original packed size.
customer_reviews.author: Sue P

customer_reviews.title: Works well for Kelty Cosmic 20
customer_reviews.text: Works very well to compress my Kelty Cosmic 20 bag. There are probably better / lighter options out there, but for the money its hard to beat this compression sack.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Martin

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding Quality Compression Sack
customer_reviews.text: High quality and attractive. I used this to compress a 30 degree bag from REI. Perfect size and great strap system. Not much else to say about it but worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Tito

customer_reviews.title: Great for sleeping bag
customer_reviews.text: Used it for my sleeping bag for a 6 day cycling tour where I didn't have to haul my gear, but was limited to one large bag for everything. Worked great to compress my sleeping bag.
customer_reviews.author: Fran T

customer_reviews.title: Not Quite Big Enough for Kelty Tuck
customer_reviews.text: Good quality bag. Too small for the Kelty Tuck 22 sleeping bag and next size up is overkill. The design appears to be incredibly rugged and should withstand quite a bit of compression (within limits).
customer_reviews.author: ZotParkerM

customer_reviews.title: Good product. Works as expected
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my Kelty Salida 2 tent. When it arrived i thought it might be too small but it works great. On a side note i dont carry my stakes and poles in the same bag. Stakes go in a pouch on my bag and the poles go in by my water bladder. One con was one the clips was actually female on both ends but i took one off and replaced it with on the tent came in. It works but its just different enough you cant unbuckle it without pliers
customer_reviews.author: Caveman Outdoors

customer_reviews.title: Definently a buy
customer_reviews.text: Works amazing for motorcycle packing. A real must have. Used on a 2700 mile motorcycle camping trip and it made packing life easy
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size, great quality construction.
customer_reviews.text: I recently purchased this for a few backpacking trips I will be taking in the next few weeks. It is working perfectly. I needed to be able to minimize the size of my sleeping bag to fit it into my pack and it was just the right size with a little left over for a few more compressible items. Without this stuff sack I was looking at having to find an alternative way to transport my sleeping bag. I am very pleased with the quality of the product as well. I can tell it is well made and can't wait to utilize this stuff sack more in the future
customer_reviews.author: William T Gleason

customer_reviews.title: Holds up well
customer_reviews.text: This holds up pretty good for the price ... have overstuffed it with a sleeping bag for a small lightweight stuff sack. Usually holds my wet weather gear. Plan on getting the next size up for fall sleeping bag.
customer_reviews.author: Craig Wheeler

customer_reviews.title: have the small. used it to hold clothes on ...
customer_reviews.text: have the small. used it to hold clothes on a backpack trip in South America. jammed it full and cinched it down hard to a very small size. opened and closed it several times with no problems. the trick is to compress it down with you hand and cinch it to that point and then push it down again and cinch it some more. the bag is very strong.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Gallagher

customer_reviews.title: Awesome piece of kit
customer_reviews.text: Awesome piece of kit. More than enough room to store and compress the gortex outer woodland camouflage bivy from the MMSS (Modular Military Sleep System). I just ordered a 2nd one, for my woobie/poncho liner.
customer_reviews.author: BigDaddyKunk

customer_reviews.title: Love these compression sacks more than my Sea to Summit ...
customer_reviews.text: Love these compression sacks more than my Sea to Summit ones. It's all about the straps. Kelty keeps it simple. My only request would be to have a larger piece of fabric at the top - not too much but just a smidge to keep the sides from popping out when compressed very tightly.
customer_reviews.author: eddy

customer_reviews.title: Excellent.
customer_reviews.text: I love this stuff sack. I wasnt sure what to expect for the price, but I have since bought two more. It folds into its own attached pouch and has a super small form factor stowed, and holds a great deal. There is a handle on the top to help pull it out of a ruck thats extremely handy. Seems to be of great quality and tough. Hard to beat for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worked, but not great.
customer_reviews.text: The compression bag was a bit small for my sleeping bag. (Probably my fault for getting the wrong size) I stuffed my SB in it with a small blue tarp and found the "compression" to be minimal. It is very durable; I reefed on the straps and it held up. For a smaller SB or clothes it might work better. In my case all it did was keep my SB rolled up on my hike, (bungee cords would have done the same) I would recommend it, but next time I'll get the XL.
customer_reviews.author: Michael DesJarlais

customer_reviews.title: Bought this to help bring down the pack size of ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to help bring down the pack size of my sleeping bag. It held up well but didn’t reduce my bag by that much, maybe a 1/4.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great stuff/compression sack.
customer_reviews.text: Love these Kelty stuff/compression sacks! Very good material and quality stitching. Very handy for creating more space in your backpack/rucksack.
customer_reviews.author: Squanto8420

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT for my 40 degree Kelty Cosmic Down bag
customer_reviews.text: PERFECT for my 40 degree Kelty Cosmic Down bag. You can really compress with these - 4 straps are awesome. They also fold back into a very small pocket.
customer_reviews.author: Paul L

customer_reviews.title: Packs down super small and light
customer_reviews.text: Packs down super small and light. Great size to compress the big bulk in your bag. I ended up picking up one of each size just to be able to condense and diversify my pack structure. Price is a bit on the high side but at the end of the day you are going to get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Freya Monster

customer_reviews.title: Great hiking compression bag.
customer_reviews.text: I used this on my hiking trip in the Rocky Mountains. It held a lot of clothes and was able to use the straps and compress it to a manageable size. When the bag is empty you can fold it up and clip it to anything. We didn't get much rain so I am not sure how water resistant it is. Overall, I really liked the set up and design of this bag. Would recommend to anybody.
customer_reviews.author: Zombieman010

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: I used it to compress my Swiss sleeping bag, and it is easy to insert my rolled up sleeping bag into it. I like that it has a built-in handle to strap to my hiking gear. Seems to be very durable. I trust Kelty brandname. Wish they have more colors to choose from beside dark blue.
customer_reviews.author: dphan

customer_reviews.title: Kelty Compression Stuff Sack (Medium)
customer_reviews.text: Purchased it for my synthetic, lightweight sleeping bag. It compresses very well and the price is right. Makes it easier to carry my sleeping bag in my backpack. This is my first purchase of a compression stuff sack and did not want to spend a lot of money. I would purchase another Kelty compression sack if needed based on this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: HR

customer_reviews.title: Way to small
customer_reviews.text: Never listed as the small model didn’t fit my Kelty sleeping bag that has the thread breaking in the seams after 30 days of backpacking
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made, but nice.
customer_reviews.text: Let me start by saying I'm a Kelty fan. I have 2 Kelty packs, so bought a compression sack to match. After getting it I immediately ordered an Alps Mountaineering for my sleeping bag because I was disappointed with the materials. The fabric is thin and not the same quality as the packs. I did not send it back as it will still be useful for clothes and other items, but I do not recommend for a sleeping bag. As for pro's...it folds up into a convenient pouch, it is relatively inexpensive, will work well for clothing and other items
customer_reviews.author: Matthew A. Dehaan

customer_reviews.title: Sizing difficult
customer_reviews.text: Do not go off of the size chart listed on the manufacturer's website. Always get one size bigger. I have a REI ZEN sleeping bag (long version) and even though I measured and purchased a compression sack that was listed to fit it, it would not. I had to go one larger. Other than that it worked flawlessly for a 3 day backpacking trip. Before the compression sack my sleeping back took up nearly all the space in my internal frame pack. With the compression sack I was able to fit all my gear inside my pack.
customer_reviews.author: hipee192012

customer_reviews.title: We use these for our bug out bags. We ...
customer_reviews.text: We use these for our bug out bags. We filled it with needed cloths, compressed it and now it's just sitting there in our bag hardly taking up space. Well, it takes up space, but nothing compared to how much space it would use up if we put our cloths in the backpack without the sack.
customer_reviews.author: Anna Kobin

customer_reviews.title: Useful
customer_reviews.text: I used this for a recent canoe trip. I put 2 full sized pillows and a sheet in here and managed to compress it down to a ball about 12 inches in diameter. You need to be sure to squeeze the sack and then cinch the straps. Do not try to use the straps to compress it. I don't think they are made for that.
customer_reviews.author: Ethan A. Hunt

customer_reviews.title: Well made and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Well made and easy to use. I could not get all of my camping gear into my kayak and by compressing the sleeping bag to half the length it gave me the extra room I needed. Being water resistant was also a bonus.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Defective sack, stitching poor
customer_reviews.text: Poor stitching and material resulted in one connector tearing off in first camping trip. Would not compress and hold after that.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry F

customer_reviews.title: A+
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly. Got one in different colors for each family member. Spent 14 days camping and living out of the car. No complaints!
customer_reviews.author: luvnsurf

customer_reviews.title: It's ok, but it was tough to tell by ...
customer_reviews.text: It's ok, but it was tough to tell by the description what the true size was. Too big would have been ok. It seems durable enough, so I can use it for things other than it's intended use while backpacking, but it's not spectacular enough to get more than an "average" rating.
customer_reviews.author: Cic626

customer_reviews.title: I bought an xl one and it works wonderfully! I was able to stuff it into the ...
customer_reviews.text: I have a thick Coleman sleeping bag and it takes up a lot of room just to pack. I bought the kelty compression stuff bag. I bought an xl one and it works wonderfully! I was able to stuff it into the compression bag with ease and after, I was able to turn the huge sleeping bag into a nice compact size. It's now a bit heavy but saves a lot of space
customer_reviews.author: MollyP

customer_reviews.title: Great product. I would buy again.
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Feels like it could rip any moment. But I was able to stuff a kelty bag into it (took 5 to 8 minutes to do it), and it was way past the boundaries of this small. I will try a medium as I'd like to also put my compressible pillow in the same compression sack. If it's truly water resistant (not waterproof), it has a leg up on the competition which don't make that claim.
customer_reviews.author: MJB9Top Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Works well, great price on Amazon!
customer_reviews.text: Fits my Marmot Sorcerer 20 degree synthetic sleeping bag well. Once stuffed in and cinched down the sleeping bag is about 1/3 the volume of the storage bag that came with it. Great for reducing the size of your sleeping bag while bike camping or just lugging your bed roll around!
customer_reviews.author: osp98

customer_reviews.title: Nice quality, but Def a lot smaller than I ...
customer_reviews.text: Nice quality, but Def a lot smaller than I thought it would of been. Will still work for what I needed it for though.
customer_reviews.author: Ariell

customer_reviews.title: Great quality stuff sack.
customer_reviews.text: My sleeping bag fit just fine in this large size and was exactly what I was looking for. It compresses and holds tight and I am happy with the quality. Oh and it also has a carry handle on the bottom should you need it.
customer_reviews.author: DR

customer_reviews.title: Cute, light, but not strong
customer_reviews.text: On first use the red fabric on the bottom end pulled out of the stitching in two places. Poor sewing. It isn't the part that contains the bag, it's more for looks, but still, weak seams are not a good sign of things to come. I like that it is lightweight but it it not very durable. I couldn't exchange it because it was out of stock, so I returned it and bought a Alps Mountaineering instead. The Alps is a lot heavier but it's obviously better made and will last a lifetime.
customer_reviews.author: PeteZ

customer_reviews.title: Durable material. Works great.
customer_reviews.text: Worked for a mutiday trek we took. Our sleeping bag came with a sack that wasn't a compression ask our even water resistant. This was a prefect alternative for a long trek and kept the contents dry and secure. We attached it to the underside if the pack, and the material was durable enough to hold up to the wear and tear off the trail, including in the rainy days.
customer_reviews.author: A. Whitworth

customer_reviews.title: Solid value!
customer_reviews.text: Arrived within two days of ordering. Perfect size for GI issue down sleeping bag. Seems solid in every respect. Had no issues as some few have reported about pulls ripping open the seams. And yes, I would recommend this to a friend.
customer_reviews.author: JeffO

customer_reviews.title: Great for underwear and summer/spring clothing
customer_reviews.text: Use it frequently when traveling. Great for underwear and summer/spring clothing.
customer_reviews.author: Cheybelle

customer_reviews.title: Great for Standard Sleeping Bag
customer_reviews.text: This was the right size for a single sleeping bag of synthetic fill. It compressed the bag 50% easily, from bigger than a basket ball to smaller than volley ball size. Quality seems good and like that it comes with a small stuff sack itself (in the flap), making it easy to store or carry when not in use. Definitely recommend and would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: L. Forsythe

customer_reviews.title: works great now. Everything else about the bag is great
customer_reviews.text: Chord dongle broke in about 5 minutes. I replaced it, works great now. Everything else about the bag is great.
customer_reviews.author: NAPGUY

customer_reviews.title: Too small for 32 degree bag
customer_reviews.text: This is a great stuff sack but it's too small for a 32 degree sleeping bag. I had to return this item and buy the medium size. It has sturdy points to synch down the sack. There is a loop on the top to hold it and it stuffs into itself and is really small. I would recommend it to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: M. Hull

customer_reviews.title: perfect size for clothes and/or to hold many of the ...
customer_reviews.text: perfect size for clothes and/or to hold many of the those small to average size things need for hiking or camping. It keeps them from floating around in your backpack and compress down nice and small when you need the space. the construction seems good. I plan to use it specifically for clothes when hiking.
customer_reviews.author: gravest

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality
customer_reviews.text: Awesome compression stuff sack. I purchased two one for and REI Lumen Long/Wide Mummy sack and the other for a Teton Sports 20+ Mummy sack. Both fit very well and compressed to 12 X 9 with no problem. Good quality for lightweight compression sack. Just take it easy
customer_reviews.author: budvb

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as described
customer_reviews.text: Compression sack works well for compressing a down sleeping bag (I used this size for a 10F down mummy bag). Used it for 5 trips so far and no problems with the straps or any of the stitching. I use it to compress the bag down to about 1/2 of it's fully expanded size. I've had a smaller one for a lighter sleeping bag for a year and never had a problem with it.
customer_reviews.author: Bouteloua

customer_reviews.title: Nice quality!
customer_reviews.text: Nice quality. Lasted through a couple of camping trips with no rips or tears.Just as good as my REI stuff sacks for a better price.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsay

customer_reviews.title: Just pulled it from the package, placed my new ...
customer_reviews.text: Just pulled it from the package, placed my new sleeping bag in it, and cinched it moderately tight. One strap is already ripping out of the seam.
customer_reviews.author: William Pigg

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy, substantial stuff sack
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy, substantial stuff sack. Use it to compress a large, sturdy duffle bag. I throw this into my carryon when I travel to have an extra bag to check through if I buy souvenirs. Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: ESL teacher

customer_reviews.title: buy it.
customer_reviews.text: I use this as a pillow when I am camping - as well as the sack I keep my clothes in. At night, I simply loosen the straps to allow it to expand and I sleep on that. In my pack it compresses nicely.
customer_reviews.author: B. J. Murrey

customer_reviews.title: One tough little pack
customer_reviews.text: I had a no-name compression pack which started tearing the first time I used it. With the Kelty, I started out being careful but soon discovered that I was being silly. If I brute forced it, I suspect I could probably cause some damage, but it's a lot stronger than the no-name bag I was carrying.
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: Great stuff sack for military woobie.
customer_reviews.text: I use this for my US woobie blanket. Fits perfectly and compresses very nice.
customer_reviews.author: Andy C

customer_reviews.title: Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.text: We used these bags one time before one of them sustained a rip on the seam. Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: It does a good job to compress an older down sleeping bag that ...
customer_reviews.text: It does a good job to compress an older down sleeping bag that is fairly lofty. You won't want to store the the sleeping bag in this stuff sack, as in the long-term it might cause the bag to loose it's loft.
customer_reviews.author: conejomoon

customer_reviews.title: Great But small problem
customer_reviews.text: I got this for 16 weeks of field work with living ranging from tents to camper trailers. I love the storage and compression my only complaint would be that one of the clips for the compression straps stopped working (actually locking against the strap to hold the compression on that side) about half way through. It simply have been that the sack was used and in constant use for almost 4 months. Note it is not water proof but darn close as long as you are not talking about submerging it in a river lake or large puddle, I would not take this one on the water with anything that would be destroyed etc.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Straps rip pretty easily
customer_reviews.text: I ordered two of these bags to use for sleeping bags on a recent trip. One of the straps ripped off of one of the bags the first time I used it -- yes, I was pulling on it pretty hard, but a compression sack should be able to handle a fairly robust yank. The other bag has held up so far. It does compress the sleeping bag much better than the crappy sack that came with the bag.
customer_reviews.author: James Austin

customer_reviews.title: Yikes!
customer_reviews.text: Med. showed up with a huge hole in the seem...just glad i didn't take it with me on the Appalachian trail for 6 months and have it happen out there. I have a smaller one I'm nervous about now...may switch it out and go with a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: Natalie Cramer

customer_reviews.title: Great for the Kelty Cosmic 20 sleeping bag.
customer_reviews.text: Used this for my Kelty Cosmic 20 sleeping bag and it packs down so small!
customer_reviews.author: Andrea Huddleston

customer_reviews.title: Green/Large is perfect for my standard 0deg Coleman Mummy bag
customer_reviews.text: Green/Large is perfect for my standard 0deg Coleman Mummy bag. Might need one size bigger when I order for a summer bag like the standard plaid/flannel tube style bag. Quality construction, nice lid that could be 1" bigger on all sides.
customer_reviews.author: Curtis G

customer_reviews.title: Kelty Compression stuff sack
customer_reviews.text: Product works great.. put a large 0o bag in it and reduced size farther than the sack the bag came with. Very Happy so far but have not "field" tested it yet. If there are issues I will edit this Post.
customer_reviews.author: David Storm

customer_reviews.title: ... - 1 for clean clothes and 1 for the dirty laundry - kept my clothes organized
customer_reviews.text: brought 2 on my 9 day travel/camping trip - 1 for clean clothes and 1 for the dirty laundry - kept my clothes organized. Great compression.
customer_reviews.author: Kristine

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Fast shipping and as described. I have bought a pair of these and they have held up remarkably well with weekly travel and most international.
customer_reviews.author: SJRD

customer_reviews.title: Pleased with it
customer_reviews.text: Compression bags at my local outdoors place run upwards of $40. This is the same item. Very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Blondegirlfrnd

customer_reviews.title: IT's Small Alright!
customer_reviews.text: ok it did say small stuff sack. NOT FOR SLEEPING BAG OF ANY SORT.
customer_reviews.author: DuckInstructor

customer_reviews.title: Great stuff sack.
customer_reviews.text: The medium fit a youth sleeping bag, just barely. It's easy to use, with two quick release clips. We haven't taken it camping yet, but it seems pretty sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: NerdK

customer_reviews.title: Nice Stuff Sack
customer_reviews.text: Nice Stuff Sack, kept by bag dry. I like the strong tie downs keeping my bag secure and compact. worth the money
customer_reviews.author: Evan Donald

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good compression sack. Use it correctly and it will treat you well.
customer_reviews.author: Craig Cunningham

customer_reviews.title: The medium sack fits my 32*C sleeping bag. I ...
customer_reviews.text: The medium sack fits my 32*C sleeping bag. I had previously purchased the small and had to return it due to it being too small.
customer_reviews.author: M. Hull

product_meta.title: Kelty Compression Stuff Sack
product_meta.description:
The Kelty Compression Stuff Sack Small will increase the available space within your pack by compressing sleeping bags and clothing down. Features Water-resistant Nylon ripstop with DWR finish.

Size Extra Large: Full size: 11 x 22" Compressed size: 11 x 10" Weight: 6 oz. 
Size Large: Full size: 10 x 18" Compressed size: 10 x 10" Weight: 5 oz. 
Size Medium: Full size: 8 x 15" Compressed size: 8 x 10" Weight: 4 oz.

Size Small: Full size: 6 x 12" Compressed size: 6 x 9" Weight: 3 oz.
feature_bullets: Kelty Compression Stuff Sack will increase the available space within your backpack by compressing sleeping bags and clothing down
Four vertical compression straps with quick-release buckles
Water-resistant nylon ripstop with DWR finish
